summary: This bill, the Veterans National Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act, proposes a pilot program within the Department of Veterans Affairs providing hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT) to veterans with traumatic brain injury or post-traumatic stress disorder, utilizing community care providers. It establishes a dedicated fund for donations to cover HBOT costs and mandates a Comptroller General report updating research on HBOT effectiveness. It's paired with a minor amendment extending limits on pension payments under section 5503(d)(7) of title 38, United States Code. The pilot program and fund will terminate three years after enactment.
